greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n-th term of A034897 is an a(n)-hyperperfect number.
reference: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Sect. B2.
Roberts, Lure of the Integers, see Integer 28, p. 177.
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Judson S. McCranie, A Study of Hyperperfect Numbers, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 3 (2000), Article 00.1.3.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hyperperfect Number.
program: (PARI) forcomposite(n=2, 10^8, if(1==Mod(n, sigma(n)-n-1), print1((n-1)/(sigma(n)-n-1)", "))) \\ _Hans Loeblich_, May 10 2019
results.author: _Jud McCranie_
